name: methyl_4-phenylbenzoate
source: Beilstein F. K.; Beilsteins Handbuch der Organischen Chemie. Springer; Berlin; 1972.
Reason: 4-phenylbenzoate has a melting point around 100 degrees Celsius. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure and raises the melting point due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. The phenyl group introduces additional pi-stacking interactions and rigidity, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius.
